metadata.title: CVE-2017-6512 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
Race condition in the rmtree and remove_tree functions in the File-Pathmodule before 2.13 for Perl allows attackers to set the mode on arbitraryfiles via vectors involving directory-permission loosening logic.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-6512` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libcgi-fast-perl - 5.18.2-2ubuntu1.4
libperl5.18 - 5.18.2-2ubuntu1.4
perl - 5.18.2-2ubuntu1.4
perl-base - 5.18.2-2ubuntu1.4
perl-debug - 5.18.2-2ubuntu1.4
perl-modules - 5.18.2-2ubuntu1.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: perl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.18.2-2ubuntu1.4').
